experiences.title: Lead Teaching Assistant for Object-Oriented Design
experiences.description: As a lead Teaching Assistant for CS3500, I led and instructed two weekly labs with around 60 students each, focusing on object-oriented design patterns. I held six weekly office hours to assist students one-on-one with their assignments and graded over 20 homework and lab assignments weekly. Additionally, I managed instructor responses on the class question forum, Piazza, providing supportive answers and encouraging critical thinking among students.

experiences.title: Teaching Assistant for Fundamentals of Computer Science II
experiences.description: As a Teaching Assistant for CS2510, I spearheaded engaging lab sessions for over 40 students, focusing on Java data structures and introductory algorithms. I conducted thorough lessons of lecture concepts and graded over 20 assignments weekly. I provided individualized support during office hours, enforcing concepts taught in lecture. Additionally, I answered questions on Piazza, encouraging critical thinking, and provided constructive feedback on assignments while also proctoring exams.

projects.name: Fakebook Web Crawler
projects.description: Devised a web crawler to traverse and find hidden flags from a large-scale mock social networking site Fakebook, using a queue-based system for managing visited and unvisited links, ensuring efficient navigation by avoiding duplicate visits. Optimized crawler performance by incorporating multithreading for concurrent HTTP requests, significantly reducing flag retrieval time from 30 minutes to 5 minutes. Made an HTML parser to extract secret flags from user profiles.

projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.description: Developed a dynamic and responsive portfolio website using React, implementing CSS Grid and Flexbox for layout management and media queries to ensure optimal display across various devices. Incorporated JSON-configurability with the entire web app, enabling dynamic content updates without code modifications. Implemented a comment page with Google OAuth2 authentication with dynamic privileges, session management with cookies, and SQLite for data storage.

projects.name: Ponjo.Pastes
projects.description: Spearheaded the development of a full-stack code snippet sharing platform using MongoDB for code storage and to track views. Integrated a comprehensive search feature, with a public API and professional documentation using styled Vitepress. Designed a responsive web UI using HTML, CSS, and Bootstrap, integrating EJS to render snippets to the frontend. Used Node.js for the backend, and provided full API documentation using Vitepress and Markdown.

projects.name: Elixir Music Bot & API
projects.description: Engineered a sharded Discord bot application serving over 350,000 users, integrating the Spotify Tracks API and YouTube for audio streaming to Discord using Ffmpeg. Implemented a REST API providing real-time bot state by guild and using POST requests to modify the bot state externally. Used MongoDB for secure user and custom playlist storage. Created an API wrapper in Python for third-party integrations and managed ISRC metadata for track identification.

projects.name: PokéVault
projects.description: Designed a dynamic web application using React, TypeScript, Vite, & Bootstrap to enable users to browse and explore a populated database of Pokémon trading cards. Implemented infinite scrolling with pagination and batch requests, optimizing performance and ensuring efficient data retrieval. The application features set browsing, comprehensive card details, a searching component, and similar card recommendations to enhance engagement.

projects.name: Wordle Solver
projects.description: I developed a client program to interact with a server to play Wordle. The objective was to guess a secret word chosen by the server by sending and receiving JSON data over a network using TCP sockets. My client program was designed to support both plain TCP and TLS encrypted sockets to ensure secure communication. I established TCP and TLS connections, created and parsed JSON messages, developed a CLI, and followed a defined communication protocol.

projects.name: Hexagonal Reversi
projects.description: Designed and implemented Orthello using Java, incorporating a hexagonal grid to enhance strategic complexity and employing Swing for the GUI and JUnit for testing. Utilized the Model-View-Controller, Strategy, Observer, Adapter, and Factory patterns to structure game architecture. Created AI strategies that enabled different difficulty levels through move-selection algorithms.

projects.name: EONET UI
projects.description: Designed and developed EONET UI using React and Bootstrap to dynamically track and visualize wildfires, severe storms, icebergs, and volcanoes utilizing NASA's EONET API. Integrated Google Maps API to display real-time geospatial data with interactive, clickable icons for each natural event, providing event info and external resources via a responsive interface.

projects.name: Robots Game & Pathfinding
projects.description: Designed a simplified test-based version of the game Chase (1984). Additionally, separately implemented functionality of a grid world, along with breadth-first-search and A* pathfinding algorithms using STL algorithms. Passed all provided test cases using a Python script for both the game and pathfinding algorithms to ensure code robustness, efficiency, and correctness.
